metadata.dc:description: We report a review about 10 cases of phlegmons-abscesses in the floor of mouth (Ludwig's angina) treated by our Service analyzing the following variables: Age, sex, time of evolution, personal antecedents, E.N.T. exploration, clinical symptoms, type of treatment and clinical evolution. This pathology represents one of the most severe forms of cervicofacial diffuse cellulitis; it requires an early diagnosis and therapy which can include an urgent tracheostomy ifthe airway is compromised.
metadata.dc:title: Flemones y abscesos del suelo de boca. An치lisis de 10 casos y revisi칩n de la literatura.
[Phlegmons and abscesses in the floor of mouth. Report of 10 cases and review of the literature].
